ground_truth: Trish lies on her back and gazes up at the ceiling. She turns to her husband, rises on her side, and tenderly grabs Sandy's shoulder. She leans in and kisses his head, to which Sandy smiles briefly. The couple stares thoughtfully into the darkness. She tilts her head, glances at Sandy, kisses the back of his neck, and rubs his shoulder as she lies down behind him. Now, Sandy walks into the living room and sees his two young daughters sleeping on the couch. Diana sleeps on the floor beside the girls and holds Frannie's hand. The young father stands over the trio and flips off a table lamp. As he slowly leaves, our view moves down to Diana and Frannie's joined hands. Later, Sandy awakens and looks at the clock, buries his face in his pillow, opens his bedroom door, and goes down the hall. He discovers Frannie and Jessie decked out in Diana-style gaudy makeup. He looks around the corner, then back to his girls. Jessie gets up, retrieves a note, and hands him a folded slip of pink paper. Sandy unfolds the note and walks past men and women in suits, nodding curtly as he passes the receptionist desk. Giving someone else a weak wave, Sandy heads to his office and pauses and looks at his name placard on the glass door. He passes it and joins a conference-room meeting already in progress, where Daniel looks up and points behind Sandy. He turns and sees Diana through the walls of an all-glass office. Sandy takes a step and peers intently at the conversation. Diana sits across from the detective, while two officers stand and watch her. Sandy goes over, opens the door, and nods stiffly. The cops leave, Sandy shoots Diana a wide-eyed stare, and Diana leaves in handcuffs and her flowing black dress. The police escort her away, and Sandy comes out of the office. He watches the repentant woman as she turns and gives a teary smile. An officer holds her arm and leads her off. Sandy goes to Daniel, who walks off, leaving Sandy standing alone. Fade to black. Now, Trish carries a cake across the yard to a table where Sandy cradles their newborn. He checks his watch. Now, in a prison's visiting yard, she holds up an exam with an A-plus grade. She gives Franny a big hug, then reaches out for Jessie. Diana pulls a document out of a large, yellow envelope and inspects it, pats the birth certificate, then slides it over to Sandy. Diana rises from the picnic table and passes behind him, then abruptly turns and embraces him. He looks at her and smiles. Sandy gathers up the envelope and stands, glancing at the paperwork in his hands.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Trish reclines on her back and gazes up at the ceiling. She turns to her spouse, rises on her side, and tenderly grasps Sandy's shoulder. She leans in and kisses his head, to which Sandy grins briefly. The pair stares thoughtfully into the gloom. She tilts her head, glances at Sandy, kisses the back of his neck, and massages his shoulder as she lies down behind him. Now, Sandy moves into the living room and observes his two young daughters slumbering on the couch. Diana sleeps on the floor beside the girls and holds Frannie's hand. The young father stands over the trio and switches off a table lamp. As he slowly departs, our view moves down to Diana and Frannie's joined hands. Later, Sandy awakens and looks at the clock, buries his face in his pillow, opens his bedroom door, and goes down the corridor. He discovers Frannie and Jessie decked out in Diana-style gaudy makeup. He looks around the corner, then back to his girls. Jessie gets up, retrieves a message, and hands him a folded slip of pink paper. Sandy unfolds the message and walks past men and women in attire, nodding curtly as he passes the receptionist counter. Giving someone else a weak wave, Sandy heads to his workplace and pauses and looks at his name placard on the glass door. He passes it and joins a conference-room meeting already in progress, where Daniel looks up and points behind Sandy. He turns and sees Diana through the walls of an all-glass office. Sandy takes a step and peers intently at the conversation. Diana sits across from the detective, while two officers stand and watch her. Sandy goes over, opens the door, and nods stiffly. The cops leave, Sandy shoots Diana a wide-eyed stare, and Diana departs in handcuffs and her flowing black dress. The police escort her away, and Sandy exits the office. He watches the repentant woman as she turns and gives a teary grin. An officer holds her arm and leads her off. Sandy goes to Daniel, who walks off, leaving Sandy standing solitary. Fade to black. Now, Trish carries a cake across the yard to a table where Sandy cradles their newborn. He checks his watch. Now, in a prison's visiting yard, she holds up an exam with an A-plus grade. She gives Franny a big hug, then reaches out for Jessie. Diana pulls a document out of a large, yellow envelope and inspects it, pats the birth certificate, then slides it over to Sandy. Diana rises from the picnic table and passes behind him, then abruptly turns and embraces him. He looks at her and smiles. Sandy gathers up the envelope and stands, glancing at the paperwork in his hands.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: On her back, Trish is lying and is gazing up at the ceiling. Her husband is turned to by her, and rising on her side, Sandy's shoulder is tenderly grabbed by her. His head is kissed by her, to which a brief smile is given by Sandy. Thoughtfully into the darkness, the couple is stared by them. Her head is tilted, Sandy is glanced at by her, the back of his neck is kissed by her, and his shoulder is rubbed by her as she lies down behind him. Now, the living room is walked into by Sandy, and his two young daughters are seen by him sleeping on the couch. On the floor beside the girls, Diana is sleeping and Frannie's hand is held by her. Over the trio, the young father stands and a table lamp is flipped off by him. As he slowly leaves, Diana and Frannie's joined hands are moved down to by our view. Later, Sandy awakens and the clock is looked at by him, his face is buried in his pillow, his bedroom door is opened, and the hall is gone down by him. He decks out Frannie and Jessie in Diana-style gaudy makeup. Around the corner is looked by him, then his girls are looked back to by him. Jessie gets up, retrieves a note, and a folded slip of pink paper is handed to him by her. The note is unfolded by Sandy and past men and women in suits, he walks, nodding curtly as the receptionist desk is passed by him. A weak wave is given by him to someone else, Sandy heads to his office, pauses, looks and his name placard on the glass door is looked at by him. It is passed by him, and a conference-room meeting already in progress is joined by him, where Daniel looks up and points behind Sandy. He turns and through the walls of an all-glass office, Diana is seen by him. A step is taken by Sandy and the conversation is peered intently at by him. Across from the detective, Diana sits, while two officers stand and watch her. Over goes Sandy, the door is opened by him, and a stiff nod is given. The cops leave, a wide-eyed stare is shot by Sandy at Diana, and in handcuffs and her flowing black dress, Diana leaves. The police escort her away, and out of the office comes Sandy. The repentant woman is watched by him as she turns and gives a teary smile. An officer holds her arm and leads her off. To Daniel goes Sandy, who walks off, leaving Sandy standing alone. Fade to black. Now, across the yard, a cake is carried by Trish to a table where their newborn is cradled by Sandy. His watch is checked by him. Now, in a prison's visiting yard, an exam with an A-plus grade is held up by her. Franny is given a big hug by her, then Jessie is reached out for by her. A document is pulled by Diana out of a large, yellow envelope and it is inspected, the birth certificate is patted, then over to Sandy, it is slid by her. From the picnic table, Diana rises and behind him, she passes, then he is abruptly turned to by her and an embrace is given to him by her. At her, he looks and a smile is given by him. Up the envelope is gathered by Sandy, and standing, a glance is given at the paperwork in his hands.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Trish lies on her back, gazing at the ceiling, then turns to her husband, rises, and gently grabs Sandy's shoulder. She kisses his head, and he smiles briefly. They stare into the darkness. Tilting her head, she glances at him, kisses his neck, and rubs his shoulder as she lies down behind him. Sandy enters the living room and sees his daughters asleep on the couch. Diana lies on the floor, holding Frannie’s hand. He stands over them and turns off a table lamp. As he leaves, the view shifts to the girls’ joined hands. Later, Sandy wakes, looks at the clock, buries his face in the pillow, opens his door, and walks down the hall. He finds Frannie and Jessie wearing Diana-style gaudy makeup. Looking around the corner, he turns back. Jessie rises, retrieves a note, and hands him a pink slip of paper. Sandy unfolds it and walks past suited men and women, nodding at the receptionist. He gives a weak wave and heads to his office, pausing at his name on the glass door. He walks past it into a conference room, where Daniel points behind him. Sandy turns to see Diana through a glass-walled office. He peers at the scene—Diana sits with a detective as two officers watch. Sandy enters, nods, and the cops exit. He stares wide-eyed at Diana, now in handcuffs and a flowing black dress. The police lead her away. As Sandy exits, she turns with a teary smile. An officer escorts her off. Sandy approaches Daniel, who walks away, leaving him alone. Fade to black. Trish carries a cake to a table where Sandy holds their newborn. He checks his watch. In a prison yard, she shows an A-plus exam, hugs Frannie, and reaches for Jessie. Diana pulls a document from a yellow envelope, pats the birth certificate, and slides it to Sandy. She stands, walks past, then turns and embraces him. He smiles. Sandy gathers the envelope and looks at the documents in hand.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Trish lies on her back, turns to her husband, and tenderly grabs Sandy's shoulder, kissing his head. They stare into the darkness. She kisses his neck and rubs his shoulder. Sandy enters the living room, sees his daughters sleeping, and flips off a lamp. He later awakens, checks the clock, and finds Frannie and Jessie in makeup. Jessie hands him a pink note. Sandy walks past suited people, nods at the receptionist, and heads to his office. In a meeting, Daniel points to Diana with a detective and officers. Sandy enters, nods, and Diana leaves in handcuffs. Sandy watches her go, then stands alone. Fade to black. Trish carries a cake to Sandy, who cradles their newborn. In a prison yard, she shows an A-plus exam, hugs Frannie, and reaches for Jessie. Diana inspects a birth certificate, slides it to Sandy, then embraces him. Sandy gathers the envelope, glancing at the paperwork.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Trish lies comfortably on her back, her eyes fixed on the ceiling above. She then turns her attention to her husband, shifting onto her side, and gently places her hand on Sandy's shoulder with a tender touch. Leaning in closer, she plants a soft kiss on his head, prompting Sandy to respond with a brief, warm smile. Together, the couple gazes thoughtfully into the enveloping darkness. Trish tilts her head slightly, casting a glance at Sandy, and then kisses the back of his neck. She soothingly rubs his shoulder as she settles down behind him.

In the next moment, Sandy makes his way into the living room, where he finds his two young daughters peacefully sleeping on the couch. Nearby, Diana is resting on the floor beside the girls, her hand gently holding Frannie's. The young father stands quietly over the trio, observing them with a tender gaze, and then reaches over to turn off a table lamp. As he slowly exits the room, our view shifts downward to focus on the joined hands of Diana and Frannie.

Later, Sandy awakens from his slumber, glances at the clock, and then buries his face into the comforting embrace of his pillow. He opens the bedroom door and walks down the hallway, where he discovers Frannie and Jessie adorned in Diana-style, gaudy makeup. He looks around the corner, taking in the scene, and then turns his attention back to his daughters. Jessie rises, retrieves a note, and hands him a folded slip of pink paper. Sandy carefully unfolds the note and proceeds to walk past men and women dressed in suits, nodding curtly as he passes by the receptionist desk. Offering a weak wave to someone else, Sandy makes his way to his office, pausing momentarily to look at his name placard on the glass door. He moves past it and joins a conference-room meeting that is already in progress. Daniel looks up and points behind Sandy, prompting him to turn and see Diana through the transparent walls of an all-glass office. Sandy takes a step forward, peering intently at the ongoing conversation. Diana sits across from the detective, while two officers stand by, watching her closely. Sandy approaches, opens the door, and nods stiffly. The cops exit, and Sandy gives Diana a wide-eyed stare as she is led away in handcuffs, her flowing black dress trailing behind her. The police escort her out, and Sandy emerges from the office, watching the repentant woman as she turns to give a teary smile. An officer holds her arm, guiding her away. Sandy then approaches Daniel, who walks off, leaving Sandy standing alone in contemplation. The scene fades to black.

Now, Trish is seen carrying a cake across the yard to a table where Sandy is cradling their newborn. He checks his watch, marking the passage of time. In a prison's visiting yard, Trish holds up an exam paper proudly displaying an A-plus grade. She gives Frannie a big, affectionate hug, then reaches out to embrace Jessie. Meanwhile, Diana pulls a document from a large, yellow envelope, inspects it, and pats the birth certificate before sliding it over to Sandy. Diana rises from the picnic table, passes behind him, and then abruptly turns to embrace him warmly. He looks at her and smiles, a gesture of understanding and connection. Sandy gathers up the envelope and stands, glancing thoughtfully at the paperwork in his hands.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Trish is lying comfortably stretched out on her back, her eyes unwaveringly focused on the ceiling above. After a moment, she shifts her attention toward her husband, gently rolling onto her side to face him. With a tender and loving touch, she gently places her hand on Sandy's shoulder. As she leans in closer, she plants a soft, affectionate kiss on the top of his head, which prompts Sandy to respond with a brief yet genuinely warm smile. Together, the couple stares thoughtfully into the enveloping darkness surrounding them. Trish tilts her head slightly, casting a thoughtful glance at Sandy, before she kisses the back of his neck with affection. She soothingly and gently rubs his shoulder as she settles down comfortably behind him.

In the moments that follow, Sandy quietly makes his way into the living room, where he finds his two young daughters peacefully sleeping on the couch. Nearby, Diana rests on the floor beside the girls, her hand gently holding Frannie's in a reassuring manner. The young father stands quietly over the trio, observing them with a tender, paternal gaze, and then he reaches over to switch off a softly glowing table lamp. As he slowly exits the dimly lit room, our view shifts downward to focus intently on the joined hands of Diana and Frannie, highlighting their connection.

Later on, Sandy awakens from his slumber, steals a glance at the clock, and then buries his face into the comforting embrace of his pillow. He opens the bedroom door and walks down the hallway, where he discovers Frannie and Jessie adorned in Diana-style, excessively gaudy makeup. He looks around the corner, taking in the somewhat surprising scene, and then refocuses his attention back on his daughters. Jessie rises to her feet, retrieves a note, and hands him a folded slip of pink paper. Sandy carefully unfolds the note and proceeds to walk past men and women dressed in formal suits, nodding curtly as he moves by the receptionist desk. Offering a weak wave to someone else, Sandy makes his way to his office, pausing momentarily to look at his name placard on the glass door. He moves past it and enters the conference room, joining a meeting that is already in progress. Daniel looks up, points behind Sandy, prompting him to turn around and see Diana through the transparent walls of an all-glass office. Sandy takes a step forward, peering intently at the serious conversation underway. Diana sits across from the detective, while two officers stand by, watching her closely. Sandy approaches the office, opens the door, and nods stiffly. The cops exit, leaving Sandy to give Diana a wide-eyed stare as she is led away in handcuffs, her flowing black dress trailing gracefully behind her. The police escort her out, and Sandy emerges from the office, watching the repentant woman as she turns to give a teary smile. An officer holds her arm, guiding her gently away. Sandy then approaches Daniel, who walks off, leaving Sandy standing alone, deep in contemplation. The scene gradually fades to black.

In the next scene, Trish is seen carrying a beautifully decorated cake across the yard to a table where Sandy is cradling their newborn. He checks his watch, marking the silent passage of time. In a prison's visiting yard, Trish proudly holds up an exam paper that boldly displays an A-plus grade. She gives Frannie a big, affectionate hug, then reaches out to embrace Jessie warmly. Meanwhile, Diana pulls a document from a large, yellow envelope, inspects it carefully, and lovingly pats the birth certificate before sliding it over to Sandy. Diana rises from the picnic table, passes behind him, and then abruptly turns to embrace him warmly. He looks at her and smiles, a gesture filled with understanding and connection. Sandy gathers up the envelope and stands, glancing thoughtfully at the paperwork in his hands as if contemplating what it all means.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Trish lies on her back, her eyes fixed on the ceiling above, as she lets her thoughts drift. She then shifts her gaze towards her husband, turning her body to rise onto her side, and with a gentle motion, she reaches out to tenderly grasp Sandy's shoulder. Leaning in closer, she places a soft kiss on his head, prompting a brief smile to appear on Sandy's face. Together, the couple allows their eyes to wander thoughtfully into the surrounding darkness. Trish tilts her head slightly, casting a glance at Sandy before planting a kiss on the back of his neck and soothingly rubbing his shoulder as she settles down behind him. Meanwhile, Sandy makes his way into the living room, where he finds his two young daughters peacefully asleep on the couch. Nearby, Diana lies on the floor, her hand clasped around Frannie's. The young father stands over the trio, taking in the serene scene before reaching out to flip off a table lamp, casting the room into a gentle shadow. As he slowly retreats, our view shifts downward to focus on the joined hands of Diana and Frannie. Later, Sandy awakens, his eyes drawn to the clock, before he buries his face into his pillow momentarily. He then opens his bedroom door and makes his way down the hall, where he discovers Frannie and Jessie adorned in Diana-style gaudy makeup. He glances around the corner, then back at his girls, taking in the sight. Jessie rises, retrieves a note, and hands him a folded slip of pink paper. Sandy carefully unfolds the note and proceeds to walk past men and women in suits, nodding curtly as he passes the receptionist desk. Offering a weak wave to someone else, Sandy continues to his office, where he pauses to look at his name placard on the glass door. He moves past it and enters a conference-room meeting already in progress, where Daniel looks up and points behind Sandy. Turning around, Sandy sees Diana through the transparent walls of an all-glass office. He takes a step forward, peering intently at the ongoing conversation. Diana sits across from the detective, with two officers standing watchfully nearby. Sandy approaches, opens the door, and nods stiffly, prompting the cops to leave. Sandy shoots Diana a wide-eyed stare as she departs in handcuffs, her flowing black dress trailing behind her. The police escort her away, and Sandy steps out of the office, watching the repentant woman as she turns to give a teary smile. An officer holds her arm, leading her off, while Sandy turns to Daniel, who walks away, leaving Sandy standing alone. The scene fades to black. Now, Trish carries a cake across the yard to a table where Sandy cradles their newborn, glancing at his watch. In a prison's visiting yard, she holds up an exam with an A-plus grade, giving Frannie a big hug before reaching out for Jessie. Diana pulls a document from a large, yellow envelope, inspects it, pats the birth certificate, and slides it over to Sandy. Rising from the picnic table, Diana passes behind him, then abruptly turns to embrace him. He looks at her and smiles, gathering up the envelope and standing, his eyes glancing over the paperwork in his hands.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Trish lies on her back, gazing at the ceiling before turning to her husband, Sandy. She tenderly grabs his shoulder, kisses his head, and they share a thoughtful moment in the darkness. She then lies down behind him, kissing the back of his neck and rubbing his shoulder. Sandy later walks into the living room, sees his daughters sleeping on the couch with Diana on the floor holding Frannie's hand, and turns off a table lamp before leaving. Our view shifts to Diana and Frannie's joined hands.

Sandy wakes up, checks the clock, and goes down the hall to find Frannie and Jessie wearing gaudy makeup. Jessie hands him a note, which he unfolds as he walks past colleagues, nodding curtly at the receptionist desk. He heads to his office, pauses at his name placard, and joins a meeting in progress. Daniel points out Diana in an all-glass office, where she sits with a detective and two officers. Sandy enters, nods stiffly, and the officers leave. Diana, in handcuffs and a flowing black dress, is escorted away, giving Sandy a teary smile. Sandy watches her leave, then goes to Daniel, who walks off, leaving Sandy alone.

Fade to black. Trish carries a cake to a table where Sandy cradles their newborn and checks his watch. In a prison visiting yard, Trish shows an A-plus exam, hugs Frannie, and reaches for Jessie. Diana pulls a birth certificate from an envelope, inspects it, and slides it to Sandy. She rises, embraces him, and he smiles. Sandy gathers the envelope, stands, and glances at the paperwork in his hands.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Trish lies on her back and gazes up at the ceiling of their modest suburban home, reflecting on the day's events. She turns to her husband, who has worked late nearly every night this week, rises on her side, and tenderly grabs Sandy's shoulder. She leans in and kisses his head, to which Sandy, a software engineer who has been under a lot of stress lately, smiles briefly. The couple stares thoughtfully into the darkness, sharing a silent moment of connection. She tilts her head, glances at Sandy, kisses the back of his neck with a familiar affection, and rubs his shoulder as she lies down behind him. Now, Sandy walks into the living room and sees his two young daughters, Jessie and Frannie, sleeping on the couch after an evening of watching family movies. Diana, a dear family friend who often helps with the children, sleeps on the floor beside the girls and holds Frannie's hand. The young father stands over the trio, contemplating the importance of family, and flips off a table lamp, casting the room into a peaceful dimness. As he slowly leaves, our view moves down to Diana and Frannie's joined hands, symbolizing a bond that's almost maternal. Later, Sandy awakens and looks at the clock, which reads 3:00 AM, buries his face in his pillow, opens his bedroom door, and goes down the hall. He discovers Frannie and Jessie decked out in Diana-style gaudy makeup, a playful rebellion inspired by Diana's vibrant personality. He looks around the corner skeptically, then back to his girls. Jessie gets up, retrieves a note, and hands him a folded slip of pink paper, likely another of Diana's spontaneous and colorful messages. Sandy unfolds the note and walks past men and women in suits at the law firm where he works, nodding curtly as he passes the receptionist desk, familiar with the morning routine. Giving someone else a weak wave, Sandy heads to his office, whose glass door bears his name placard, a visible mark of his professional success. He passes it and joins a conference-room meeting already in progress, where Daniel, his long-time colleague, looks up and points behind Sandy. He turns and sees Diana through the walls of an all-glass office, creating a stark contrast between her vibrant presence and the sterile work environment. Sandy takes a step and peers intently at the conversation, sensing the gravity of the situation. Diana sits across from the detective, while two officers stand and watch her, appearing cautious yet intrigued by her composed demeanor. Sandy goes over, opens the door, and nods stiffly, a silent acknowledgment of the unfolding drama. The cops leave, Sandy shoots Diana a wide-eyed stare, and Diana leaves in handcuffs and her flowing black dress, a dramatic departure that signals an unexpected turn of events. The police escort her away, and Sandy comes out of the office, feeling a mixture of confusion and concern. He watches the repentant woman as she turns and gives a teary smile, full of regret and a hint of hope. An officer holds her arm and leads her off, a somber moment of parting. Sandy goes to Daniel, who walks off, leaving Sandy standing alone with his thoughts. Fade to black, marking a transition to a new chapter. Now, Trish carries a cake across the yard to a table where Sandy cradles their newborn, a symbol of new beginnings and hope. He checks his watch, aware of how quickly time passes. Now, in a prison's visiting yard, Diana, serving time for an undisclosed crime, holds up an exam with an A-plus grade, showing her determination to better herself. She gives Frannie a big hug, then reaches out for Jessie, cherishing these precious moments. Diana pulls a document out of a large, yellow envelope and inspects it, pats the birth certificate, then slides it over to Sandy, indicating an important legal decision regarding the children's future. Diana rises from the picnic table and passes behind him, then abruptly turns and embraces him, a gesture of gratitude and reconciliation. He looks at her and smiles, appreciating the complexities of love and forgiveness. Sandy gathers up the envelope and stands, glancing at the paperwork in his hands, which signifies the ongoing journey of their intertwined lives.

Later Sandy awakens and looks at the clock buries his face in his pillow opens his bedroom door and goes down the hall. He discovers Frannie and Jessie decked out in Dianastyle gaudy makeup. He looks around the corner then back to his girls. Jessie gets up retrieves a note and hands him a folded slip of pink paper. Sandy unfolds the note and walks past men and women in suits nodding curtly as he passes the receptionist desk. Giving someone else a weak wave. Sandy heads to his office and pauses and looks at his name placard on the glass door. He passes it and joins a conferenceroom meeting already in progress where Daniel looks up and points behind Sandy. He turns and sees Diana through the walls of an allglass office. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Sandy takes a step and peers intently at the conversation. Diana sits across from the detective while two officers stand and watch her. Sandy goes over opens the door and nods stiffly. The cops leave. Sandy shoots Diana a wideeyed stare and Diana leaves in handcuffs and her flowing black dress. The police escort her away and Sandy comes out of the office. He watches the repentant woman as she turns and gives a teary smile. An officer holds her arm and leads her off. Sandy goes to Daniel who walks off leaving Sandy standing alone. Fade to black. Now Trish carries a cake across the yard to a table where Sandy cradles their newborn. He checks his watch. Now in a prison's visiting yard she holds up an exam with an Aplus grade. She gives Franny a big hug then reaches out for Jessie. Diana pulls a document out of a large yellow envelope and inspects it pats the birth certificate then slides it over to Sandy. Diana rises from the picnic table and passes behind him then abruptly turns and embraces him. He looks at her and smiles. Sandy gathers up the envelope and stands glancing at the paperwork in his hands.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Trish lies on her back and gazes up at the ceiling. She turns to her husband rises on her side and tenderly grabs Sandy's shoulder. She leans in and kisses his head to which Sandy smiles briefly. The couple stares thoughtfully into the darkness. She tilts her head glances at Sandy kisses the back of his neck and rubs his shoulder as she lies down behind him. Now Sandy walks into the living room and sees his two young daughters sleeping on the couch. Diana sleeps on the floor beside the girls and holds Frannie's hand. The young father stands over the trio and flips off a table lamp. As he slowly leaves our view moves down to Diana and Frannie's joined hands. Fade to black. Now Trish carries a cake across the yard to a table where Sandy cradles their newborn. He checks his watch. Now in a prison's visiting yard she holds up an exam with an Aplus grade. She gives Franny a big hug then reaches out for Jessie. Diana pulls a document out of a large yellow envelope and inspects it pats the birth certificate then slides it over to Sandy. Diana rises from the picnic table and passes behind him then abruptly turns and embraces him. He looks at her and smiles. Sandy gathers up the envelope and stands glancing at the paperwork in his hands.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Trish lies on her back and gazes up at the ceiling. She turns to her husband rises on her side and tenderly grabs Sandy's shoulder. She leans in and kisses his head to which Sandy smiles briefly. The couple stares thoughtfully into the darkness. Diana pulls a document out of a large yellow envelope and inspects it pats the birth certificate then slides it over to Sandy. Diana rises from the picnic table and passes behind him then abruptly turns and embraces him. He looks at her and smiles. Sandy gathers up the envelope and stands glancing at the paperwork in his hands.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Gerald swims on his stomach and glances down at the carpet. He yawns to his brother, sinks on his belly, and gently taps Bert's elbow. He stretches out and nudges his foot, to which Bert giggles quietly. The friends listen intently to the noise. He scratches his ear, peers at Bert, nudges the back of his hand, and tickles his elbow as he curls up beside him. Now, Bert skips into the bathroom and notices his two little kittens prancing on the windowsill. Carol naps on the mat next to the felines and strokes Lucy's paw. The elder brother crouches over the quartet and turns on a ceiling fan. As he quickly arrives, our view shifts up to Carol and Lucy's intertwined tails. Later, Bert dozes off and stares at the ceiling, slaps his hand on his chest, shuts the closet window, and runs up the stairs. He uncovers Lucy and Maxine decked out in Carol-style elegant dresses. He peeks under the couch, then back to his kittens. Maxine leaps up, grabs a pencil, and tosses him a crumpled ball of red yarn. Bert untangles the yarn and skips alongside children and animals in aprons, waving warmly as he skips the janitor's closet. Giving someone else a firm handshake, Bert strides into his attic and stops and gazes at his name tag on the wooden crate. He ducks under it and joins a cellar party already in full swing, where Simon leans in and gestures above Bert. He ducks and spots Carol through the panes of an all-plastic tent. Bert tiptoes closer and listens carefully to the laughter. Carol perches across from the comedian, while two singers sit and applaud her. Bert ambles over, shuts the gate, and grins widely. The singers bow, Bert throws Carol a puzzled glance, and Carol vanishes in stilettos and her bright red jacket. The singers guide her away, and Bert slips out of the tent. He watches the jubilant singer as she spins and gives a joyful wave. A singer squeezes her shoulder and guides her on stage. Bert glides to Simon, who runs away, leaving Bert lingering alone. Cut to blue. Now, Gerald juggles a pie across the driveway to a swing where Bert cradles their puppy. He sets his glasses. Now, in a cathedral's parking lot, she displays a drawing with a gold star. She gives Lucy a tight cuddle, then reaches over for Maxine. Carol draws a poster from a small, green backpack and examines it, rubs the postcard, then swings it over to Bert. Carol stands from the garden bench and shuffles around him, then gently turns and high-fives him. He winks at her and laughs. Bert collects the backpack and strolls, admiring the art in his arms.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Trish and Sandy share a quiet, tender moment before Sandy checks on their sleeping daughters, Diana, Frannie, and Jessie. Later, Sandy discovers his daughters in makeup and receives a note from Jessie. He goes to work, passing colleagues, and joins a meeting where he notices Diana with a detective. After Diana is escorted away in handcuffs, Sandy is left alone. Time passes, and Trish brings a cake to Sandy, who holds their newborn. In a prison yard, Diana shows an exam with an A-plus to Frannie and Jessie, then hands Sandy a birth certificate. She hugs him before leaving, and Sandy looks at the paperwork thoughtfully.
